page.title: 12HISTORY-OTLEY,MENSTON,BURLEY
page.content: It is quite likely that Burley-in- Wharfedale was once a Roman out-post, and that there was a Saxon settlement there before that. Burley remained almost unchanged for centuries until the cotton industry came to the area. The mill was worked almost entirely by children sent down from London. In the 1850 the old mill was demolished, and the present buildings erected, and also the mill school was founded. It was the first one of it's kind. { }OTLEY-The history of Otley dates back to Saxon times. In the year 937, King Athelstan defeated the Danes at Brunanburgh and granted the Manor of Otley to Archbishop Wulfstan of York. MENSTON-Today,the only evidence of the earliest habitation on the moors south of Menston are cup and ring markings and stone circles.In the 19th century Menston was an industrial town
